title: What is homestead and non homestead? - Quora

response.answer_text: Homesteading, at its core, is the endeavor to live a more self-reliant and self-sustainable life. For quite some time, people have ‘homesteaded’ in many different places, such as the country on several acres of land or in urban setting. We are weary to define what homesteading is or what it is not so we rely on the intent of homesteading, as we stated above. Admittedly, there are those who believe that a real homestead is where someone lives off the land on several acres and limit their reliance on public utilities or amenities. However, people are now employing homestead practices in more urban settings and the suburbs. There is also a legal aspect to homesteading, which each state has different requirements for. In essence, being considered a ‘homestead’ offers tax reductions for the occupant. Your Homestead Is What You Make It — CampFIRE Homesteading
